result.execSummary:
The defendant Forrest L. Sparks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.
Concurrent with: 12CF309

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: All financials same as noted above.

Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.
Concurrent with: Count 1

letter from defendant and response from Judge Kussel - no furlough

Atty. Parker appeared on behalf of the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Dodge appeared wtih the Def. Forrest L. Sparks. State is seeking to amend Count 2 from Felony bail jumping to misd. bail jumping. Atty. Dodge informs the court his client will therefore plead GNC to Counts 1 & 2. Court questions the Def. verbally and accepts his revocation agreement. Court proceeds into sentencing on both cases.
Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Pictures & prints.
Absolute sobriety.
No Class B establishments.
No travel outside the state without Court approval.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing
